attributes.action: Ban the sale of fireworks to the general public
attributes.additional_details: The firework season can be distressing for many. The RSPCA receives about 400 calls a year about fireworks, with countless unreported cases of frightened animals. It’s also tough for veterans; over two-thirds want stricter regulations due to PTSD triggers. Plus, more than 550 kids under 16 visit A&E around Bonfire Night due to firework injuries. Banning the sale of fireworks to the public would reduce these risks, allowing for safer, community-organised displays that everyone can enjoy without the chaos and danger of personal use.
attributes.background: I really think the UK should ban the sale of fireworks to the public. They’re dangerous, cause a lot of stress for pets, and can be pretty bad for the environment. Let’s keep celebrations safe and fun by having community displays instead—much better for everyone!

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/700013
